problem: Find the integer $n,$ $-90 \le n \le 90,$ such that $\sin n^\circ = \sin 1021^\circ.$
solution:
Since the sine function has period $360^\circ,$
\[\sin 1021^\circ = \sin (1021^\circ - 3 \cdot 360^\circ) = \sin (-59^\circ),\]so $n = \boxed{-59}.$
gptanswer:
We know that $\sin (1021^\circ - 360^\circ) = \sin 301^\circ.$ Also, $\sin (1021^\circ - 720^\circ) = \sin 301^\circ.$ Since the sine function has period $360^\circ,$ we have that $\sin 1021^\circ = \sin (1021^\circ - 2 \cdot 360^\circ) = \sin (1021^\circ - 3 \cdot 360^\circ) = \cdots = \sin 301^\circ.$

Therefore, $n = \boxed{301}.$
